fields.name: VERSION_ID
fields.desc: VERSION_ID[7:0]: version of the embedded IP.

fields.name: CONT
fields.desc:
CONT: regular sequence runs continuously when ADC mode is enabled:

0: enable the single conversion: when the sequence is over, the conversion stops

1: enable the continuous conversion: when the sequence is over, the sequence starts again

until the software sets the CTRL.STOP_OP_MODE bit.

fields.name: SEQUENCE
fields.desc:
SEQUENCE: enable the sequence mode (active by default):

0: sequence mode is disabled, only SEQ0 is selected

1: sequence mode is enabled, conversions from SEQ0 to SEQx with x=SEQ_LEN

Note: clearing this bit is equivalent to SEQUENCE=1 and SEQ_LEN=0000. Ideally, this bit can

be kept high as redundant with keeping high and setting SEQ_LEN=0000.

fields.name: SEQ_LEN
fields.desc:
SEQ_LEN[3:0]: number of conversions in a regular sequence:

0000: 1 conversion, starting from SEQ0

0001: 2 conversions, starting from SEQ0

...

1111: 16 conversions, starting from SEQ0

fields.name: SMPS_SYNCHRO_ENA
fields.desc:
SMPS_SYNCHRO_ENA: synchronize the ADC start conversion with a pulse generated by the

SMPS:

0: SMPS synchronization is disabled for all ADC clock frequencies

1: SMPS synchronization is enabled (only when ADC clock is 8 MHz or 16 MHz)

Note: SMPS_SYNCHRO_ENA must be 0 when the ADC analog clock is 32 MHz or when

PWRC_CR5.NOSMPS = 1.

fields.name: SAMPLE_RATE_LSB
fields.desc:
SAMPLE_RATE_LSB: Sample Rate LSB

This field is an extension of SAMPLE_RATE definition in bits 12,11 of CONF register. It

impacts the conversion rate of ADC (F_ADC). See SAMPLE_RATE bits for the full description.

When this field is set to a value different than 0, SMPS synchronization is not feasible.

This value is hidden to the user

fields.name: SAMPLE_RATE
fields.desc:
SAMPLE_RATE[1:0]: conversion rate of ADC (F_ADC):

F_ADC = F_ADC_CLK/(16 + 16*SAMPLE_RATE_MSB + 4*SAMPLE_RATE + SAMPLE_RATE_LSB),where

F_ADC_CLK is the analog ADC clock frequency. By default F_ADC_CLK is 16MHz frequency.

fields.name: DMA_DS_ENA
fields.desc:
DMA_DS_EN: enable the DMA mode for the Down Sampler data path:

0: DMA mode is disabled

1: DMA mode is enabled

fields.name: OVR_DS_CFG
fields.desc:
OVR_DS_CFG: Down Sampler overrun configuration:

0: the previous data is kept, the new one is lost

1: the previous data is lost, the new one is kept

fields.name: BIT_INVERT_SN
fields.desc:
BIT_INVERT_SN: invert bit to bit the ADC data output (1's complement) when a single

negative input is connected to the ADC:

0: no inversion (default)

1: enable the inversion

fields.name: BIT_INVERT_DIFF
fields.desc:
BIT_INVERT_DIFF: invert bit to bit the ADC data output (1's complement) when a differential

input is connected to the ADC:

0: no inversion (default)

1: enable the inversion

fields.name: ADC_CONT_1V2
fields.desc:
ADC_CONT_1V2: select the input sampling method:

0: sampling only at conversion start (default)

1: sampling starts at the end of conversion

fields.name: SAMPLE_RATE_MSB
fields.desc:
SAMPLE_RATE_MSB: Sample Rate MSB

This field is an extension of SAMPLE_RATE definition in bits 12,11 of CONF register. It

impacts the conversion rate of ADC (F_ADC). See SAMPLE_RATE bits for the full description

fields.name: ADC_ON_OFF
fields.desc:
ADC_ON_OFF:

0: power off the ADC

1: power on the ADC

fields.name: START_CONV
fields.desc:
START_CONV (1): generate a start pulse to initiate an ADC conversion:

0: no effect

1: start the ADC conversion

Note: this bit is set by software and cleared by hardware.

fields.name: STOP_OP_MODE
fields.desc:
STOP_OP_MODE (1): stop the on-going OP_MODE (ADC mode, Analog audio mode, Full

mode):

0: no effect

1: stop on-going ADC mode

Note: this bit is set by software and cleared by hardware.

When setting the STOP_MODE_OP, the user has to wait around 10 us before to start a new ADC conversion by setting the START_CONV bit.

fields.name: TEST_MODE
fields.desc:
TEST_MODE: select the functional or the test mode of the ADC:

0: functional mode (one of the four main functional modes is used)

1: test mode (for debug, test, calibration)

fields.name: SE_VIN_0
fields.desc:
SE_VIN_0[1:0]: input voltage for VINM[0] / VINP[0]-VINM[0]

00: Vinput = 1.2V

01: reserved (not used for this cut)

10: Vinput = 2.4V

11: Vinput = 3.6V

fields.name: SE_VIN_1
fields.desc:
SE_VIN_1[1:0]: input voltage for VINM[1] / VINP[1]-VINM[1]

01: reserved (not used for this cut)

10: Vinput = 2.4V

11: Vinput = 3.6V

fields.name: SE_VIN_2

01: reserved (not used for this cut)

10: Vinput = 2.4V

11: Vinput = 3.6V

fields.name: SE_VIN_3
fields.desc:

00: Vinput = 1.2V

10: Vinput = 2.4V

fields.name: SE_VIN_4
fields.desc:

00: Vinput = 1.2V

01: reserved (not used for this cut)

10: Vinput = 2.4V

11: Vinput = 3.6V

fields.name: SE_VIN_5
fields.desc:
SE_VIN_5[1:0]: input voltage for VINP[1]

00: Vinput = 1.2V

01: reserved (not used for this cut)

10: Vinput = 2.4V

11: Vinput = 3.6V

fields.name: SE_VIN_6
fields.desc:
SE_VIN_6[1:0]: input voltage for VINP[2]

00: Vinput = 1.2V

01: reserved (not used for this cut)

10: Vinput = 2.4V

11: Vinput = 3.6V

fields.name: SE_VIN_7
fields.desc:
SE_VIN_7[1:0]: input voltage for VINP[3]

00: Vinput = 1.2V

01: reserved (not used for this cut)

10: Vinput = 2.4V

11: Vinput = 3.6V

fields.name: DS_RATIO
fields.desc:
DS_RATIO[2:0]: program the Down Sampler ratio (N factor)

000: ratio = 1, no down sampling (default)

001: ratio = 2

010: ratio = 4

011: ratio = 8

100: ratio = 16

101: ratio = 32

110: ratio = 64

111: ratio = 128

fields.name: DS_WIDTH
fields.desc:
DS_WIDTH[2:0]: program the Down Sampler width of data output (DSDTATA)

000: DS_DATA output on 12-bit (default)

001: DS_DATA output on 13-bit

010: DS_DATA output on 14-bit

011: DS_DATA output on 15-bit

100: DS_DATA output on 16-bit

1xx: reserved

fields.name: SEQ0
fields.desc:
SEQ0[3:0]: channel number code for first conversion of the sequence

0000: VINM[0] to ADC single negative input

0001: VINM[1] to ADC single negative input

0010: VINM[2] to ADC single negative input

0011: VINM[3] to ADC single negative input

0100: VINP[0] to ADC single positive input

0101: VINP[1] to ADC single positive input

0110: VINP[2] to ADC single positive input

0111: VINP[3] to ADC single positive input

1000: VINP[0]-VINM[0] to ADC differential input

1001: VINP[1]-VINM[1] to ADC differential input

1010: VINP[2]-VINM[2] to ADC differential input

1011: VINP[3]-VINM[3] to ADC differential input

1100: VBAT - Battery level detector

1101: Temperature sensor

111x: reserved

fields.name: SEQ1
fields.desc:
SEQ1[3:0]: channel number code for second conversion of the sequence.

See SEQ0 for code detail.

fields.name: SEQ2
fields.desc:
SEQ2[3:0]: channel number code for 3rd conversion of the sequence.

See SEQ0 for code detail.

fields.name: SEQ3
fields.desc:
SEQ3[3:0]: channel number code for 4th conversion of the sequence.

See SEQ0 for code detail.

fields.name: SEQ4
fields.desc:
SEQ4[3:0]: channel number code for 5th conversion of the sequence.

See SEQ0 for code detail.

fields.name: SEQ5
fields.desc:
SEQ5[3:0]: channel number code for 6th conversion of the sequence.

See SEQ0 for code detail.

fields.name: SEQ6
fields.desc:
SEQ6[3:0]: channel number code for 7th conversion of the sequence.

fields.name: SEQ7

SEQ7[3:0]: channel number code for 8th conversion of the sequence.

fields.name: SEQ8

0000: VINM[0] to ADC single negative input

0001: VINM[1] to ADC single negative input

0010: VINM[2] to ADC single negative input

0011: VINM[3] to ADC single negative input

0100: VINP[0] to ADC single positive input

0101: VINP[1] to ADC single positive input

0110: VINP[2] to ADC single positive input

0111: VINP[3] to ADC single positive input

1000: VINP[0]-VINM[0] to ADC differential input

1001: VINP[1]-VINM[1] to ADC differential input

1010: VINP[2]-VINM[2] to ADC differential input

1011: VINP[3]-VINM[3] to ADC differential input

1100: VBAT - Battery level detector

1101: Temperature sensor

111x: reserved

fields.name: SEQ9
fields.desc:

See SEQ0 for code detail.

fields.name: SEQ10
fields.desc:
SEQ10[3:0]: channel number code for 11th conversion of the sequence.

See SEQ0 for code detail.

fields.name: SEQ11

SEQ11[3:0]: channel number code for 12th conversion of the sequence.

fields.name: SEQ12

fields.name: SEQ13

SEQ13[3:0]: channel number code for 14th conversion of the sequence.

fields.name: SEQ14

SEQ14[3:0]: channel number code for 15th conversion of the sequence.

fields.name: SEQ15

SEQ15[3:0]: channel number code for 16th conversion of the sequence.

See SEQ0 for code detail.

fields.name: GAIN1
fields.desc: GAIN1[11:0]: first calibration point: gain AUXADC_GAIN_1V2[11:0]

fields.name: OFFSET1

fields.name: GAIN2
fields.desc: GAIN2[11:0]: second calibration point: gain AUXADC_GAIN_1V2[11:0]

fields.name: OFFSET2
fields.desc: OFFSET2[7:0]: second calibration point

fields.name: GAIN3
fields.desc: GAIN3[11:0]: third calibration point: gain AUXADC_GAIN_1V2[11:0]

fields.name: OFFSET_GAIN0
fields.desc:
OFFSET_GAIN0[1:0]: gain / offset used in ADC single negative mode with Vinput range =

1.2V:

00: OFFSET1 and GAIN1 from COMP_1

01: OFFSET2 and GAIN2 from COMP_2

10: OFFSET3 and GAIN3 from COMP_3

11: OFFSET4 and GAIN4 from COMP_4

fields.name: OFFSET_GAIN1
fields.desc:

1.2V. This field also selects the gain/offset for Temperature Sensor input::

00: OFFSET1 and GAIN1 from COMP_1

01: OFFSET2 and GAIN2 from COMP_2

10: OFFSET3 and GAIN3 from COMP_3

11: OFFSET4 and GAIN4 from COMP_4

fields.name: OFFSET_GAIN2
fields.desc:
OFFSET_GAIN2[1:0]: gain / offset used in ADC differential mode with Vinput range = 1.2V:

00: OFFSET1 and GAIN1 from COMP_1

01: OFFSET2 and GAIN2 from COMP_2

10: OFFSET3 and GAIN3 from COMP_3

11: OFFSET4 and GAIN4 from COMP_4

fields.name: OFFSET_GAIN3

fields.name: OFFSET_GAIN5

fields.name: OFFSET_GAIN6

fields.name: WD_LT
fields.desc: WD_LT[11:0]: analog watchdog low level threshold.

fields.name: WD_HT
fields.desc: WD_HT[11:0]: analog watchdog high level threshold.

fields.name: AWD_CHX
fields.desc:
AWD_CHX[15:0]: analog watchdog channel selection to define which input channel(s) need

to be guarded by the watchdog.

Bit0: VINM[0] to ADC negative input

Bit1: VINM[1] to ADC negative input

Bit2: VINM[2] to ADC negative input

Bit3: VINM[3] to ADC negative input

Bit4: Not used

Bit5: VBAT to ADC negative input

Bit6: GND to ADC negative input

Bit7: VDDA to ADC negative input

Bit8: VINP[0] to ADC positive input

Bit9: VINP[1] to ADC positive input

Bit10: VINP[2] to ADC positive input

Bit11: VINP[3] to ADC positive input

Bit12: Not used

Bit13: TEMP to ADC positive input

Bit14: GND to ADC positive input

Bit15: VDDA to ADC positive input

fields.name: DS_DATA
fields.desc: DS_DATA[15:0]: contain the converted data at the output of the Down Sampler.

fields.name: EOC_IRQ
fields.desc:
EOC_IRQ (Used in test mode only): set when the ADC conversion is completed.

When read, provide the status of the interrupt:

0: ADC conversion is not completed

1: ADC conversion is completed

Writing this bit clears the status of the interrupt:

0: no effect

1: clear the interrupt

fields.name: EODS_IRQ
fields.desc:
EODS_IRQ: set when the Down Sampler conversion is completed.

When read, provide the status of the interrupt:

0: Down Sampler conversion is not completed

1: Down Sampler conversion is completed

Writing this bit clears the status of the interrupt:

0: no effect

1: clear the interrupt

fields.name: EOS_IRQ
fields.desc:
EOS_IRQ: set when a sequence of conversion is completed.

When read, provide the status of the interrupt:

0: sequence of conversion is not completed

1: sequence of conversion is completed

Writing this bit clears the status of the interrupt:

0: no effect

1: clear the interrupt

fields.name: AWD_IRQ
fields.desc:
AWD_IRQ: set when an analog watchdog event occurs.

When read, provide the status of the interrupt:

0: no analog watchdog event occurred

1: analog watchdog event has occurred

Writing this bit clears the status of the interrupt:

0: no effect

1: clear the interrupt

fields.name: OVR_DS_IRQ
fields.desc:
OVR_DS_IRQ: set to indicate a Down Sampler overrun (at least one data is lost)

When read, provide the status of the interrupt:

0: no overrun occurred

1: overrun occurred

Writing this bit clears the status of the interrupt:

0: no effect

1: clear the interrupt

fields.name: EOC_IRQ
fields.desc:
EOC_IRQ (Used in test mode only): set when the ADC conversion is completed.

When read, provide the status of the interrupt:

0: ADC conversion is not completed

1: ADC conversion is completed

Writing this bit clears the status of the interrupt:

0: no effect

1: clear the interrupt

fields.name: EODS_IRQ
fields.desc:
EODS_IRQ: set when the Down Sampler conversion is completed.

When read, provide the status of the interrupt:

0: Down Sampler conversion is not completed

1: Down Sampler conversion is completed

Writing this bit clears the status of the interrupt:

0: no effect

1: clear the interrupt

fields.name: EOS_IRQ
fields.desc:
EOS_IRQ: set when a sequence of conversion is completed.

When read, provide the status of the interrupt:

0: sequence of conversion is not completed

1: sequence of conversion is completed

Writing this bit clears the status of the interrupt:

0: no effect

1: clear the interrupt

fields.name: AWD_IRQ
fields.desc:
AWD_IRQ: set when an analog watchdog event occurs.

When read, provide the status of the interrupt:

0: no analog watchdog event occurred

1: analog watchdog event has occurred

Writing this bit clears the status of the interrupt:

0: no effect

1: clear the interrupt

fields.name: OVR_DS_IRQ
fields.desc:
OVR_DS_IRQ: set to indicate a Down Sampler overrun (at least one data is lost)

When read, provide the status of the interrupt:

0: no overrun occurred

1: overrun occurred

Writing this bit clears the status of the interrupt:

0: no effect

1: clear the interrupt

fields.name: ADC_SWITCH_EN
fields.desc:
ADC_SWITCH_EN[15:0]: enable individually each connection of the switching matrix at the

ADC input.

For each bit:

0: switch X is ON

1: switch X is OFF

Bit mapping (corresponding to AUXADC_INSEL_1V2[15:0]):

Bit 0: VINM[0] to ADC negative input

Bit 1: VINM[1] to ADC negative input

Bit 2: VINM[2] to ADC negative input

Bit 3: VINM[3] to ADC negative input

Bit4: GND to ADC negative input

Bit5: VBAT to ADC negative input

Bit6: GND to ADC negative input

Bit7: VDDA to ADC negative input

Bit8: VINP[0] to ADC positive input

Bit9: VINP[1] to ADC positive input

Bit10: VINP[2] to ADC positive input

Bit11: VINP[3] to ADC positive input

Bit12: VBAT to ADC positive input

Bit13: TEMP to ADC positive input

Bit14: GND to ADC positive input

Bit15: VDDA to ADC positive input.

fields.name: SEL_VIN_TYPE
fields.desc:
SEL_VIN_TYPE[1:0]: operation mode of the selected VIN

00: ADC single negative input

01: ADC single positive input

10: ADC differential input mode

11: reserved

fields.name: ADC_RUN
fields.desc:
ADC_RUN: Start/stop ADC conversion.

0: stop the ADC conversion,

1: starts the ADC conversion.

fields.name: ADC_ENABLE
fields.desc:
ADC_ENABLE:

0: disable the ADC (power OFF)

1: enable the ADC (power ON)

fields.name: ADC_DBG_CONF
fields.desc: ADC_DBG_CONF[3:0]: use for debug purpose.

fields.name: ADC_DTB_CONF
fields.desc:
ADC_DTB_CONF[1:0]: configure the DTB output.

00: DTB bus is all 0

01: output the ADC_BUSY, ADC_EOC, offset compensation data[11:0] on the ADC_DTB

10: output the DS information on the ADC_DTB

11: select states of the FSM and enable ADC serial output

Note: detailed DTB configurations are available in the Table 38 in IUM

fields.name: DTB_SER_SEL
fields.desc:
DTB_SER_SEL: DTB serial output selection when ADC_DB_CONF[1:0]=3d

0: pre down-sampler with offset compensation data

1: post down-sampler data

fields.name: FSM_STATE
fields.desc:
FSM_STATE[7:0]: show the state of the state machine.

Bit 0: IDLE

Bit 1: Reserved

Bit 2: ADC setup phase

Bit 3: Reserved

Bit 4: ADC_START_CONV resynchronization

Bit 5: Reserved

Bit 6: ADC mode

Bit 7: sequence mode

fields.name: FSM_CUR_STATE
fields.desc:
FSM_CUR_STATE[2:0]: show the last executed state by the state machine.

000: IDLE mode

001: Reserved

010: ADC setup phase

011: Reserved

100: ADC_START_CONV resynchronization

101: Reserved

110: ADC mode

111: sequence mode

fields.name: EN
fields.desc: EN: AES IP enable

fields.name: DATATYPE
fields.desc: DATATYPE[1:0]: Data type selection

fields.name: MODE
fields.desc: MODE[1:0]: AES operating mode

fields.name: CHMOD_1_0
fields.desc: CHMOD[1:0]: AES Chaining Mode selection

fields.name: CCFC
fields.desc: CCFC: Computation Complete Flag Clear

fields.name: ERRC

fields.name: CCFIE

fields.name: ERRIE

fields.desc: DMAINEN: DMA Input Enable

fields.name: DMAOUTEN
fields.desc: DMAOUTEN: DMA Output Enable

fields.name: GCMPH

fields.name: CHMOD_2

fields.name: DINR
fields.desc: DINR[x+31:x]: One of four 32-bit words of a 128-bit input data block being written into the peripheral

fields.name: DOUTR
fields.desc: DOUTR[x+31:x]: One of four 32-bit words of a 128-bit output data block being read from the

fields.name: IVI
fields.desc: IVI [((32*x)+31):((32*x)+0)]: Initialization vector register (LSB IVR[((32*x)+31):((32*x)+0)])

fields.name: IVI
fields.desc: IVI [((32*x)+31):((32*x)+0)]: Initialization vector register (LSB IVR[((32*x)+31):((32*x)+0)])

fields.name: IVI
fields.desc: IVI [((32*x)+31):((32*x)+0)]: Initialization vector register (LSB IVR[((32*x)+31):((32*x)+0)])

fields.name: IVI
fields.desc: IVI [((32*x)+31):((32*x)+0)]: Initialization vector register (LSB IVR[((32*x)+31):((32*x)+0)])

fields.name: DR
fields.desc:
Data register bits.
This register is used to write new data to the CRC calculator. It holds the previous CRC calculation result when it is read.
If the data size is less than 32 bits, the least significant bits are used to write/read the
correct value.

fields.name: RESET
fields.desc:
RESET bit
This bit is set by software to reset the CRC calculation unit and set the data register to the value
stored in the CRC_INIT register. This bit can only be set, it is automatically cleared by hardware

fields.name: POLYSIZE
fields.desc:
Polynomial size
These bits control the size of the polynomial.
-00: 32 bit polynomial
-01: 16 bit polynomial
-10: 8 bit polynomial
-11: 7 bit polynomial

fields.name: REV_IN
fields.desc:
Reverse input data
These bits control the reversal of the bit order of the input data
-00: Bit order not affected
-01: Bit reversal done by byte
-10: Bit reversal done by half-word
-11: Bit reversal done by word

fields.name: REV_OUT
fields.desc:
Reverse output data
This bit controls the reversal of the bit order of the output data.
-0: Bit order not affected
-1: Bit-reversed output format

fields.name: INIT
fields.desc:
Programmable initial CRC value
This register is used to write the CRC initial value.

fields.name: POL
fields.desc:
POL[31:0]: Programmable polynomial
This register is used to write the coefficients of the polynomial to be used for CRC calculation.
If the polynomial size is less than 32 bits, the least significant bits have to be used to program the
correct value.

fields.name: EN
fields.desc:
EN: Comparator enable bit

This bit is set and cleared by software (only if LOCK not set). It switches on Comparator.

0: Comparator switched OFF

1: Comparator switched ON

fields.name: PWRMODE
fields.desc:
PWRMODE[1:0]: Power Mode of the comparator

These bits are set and cleared by software (only if LOCK not set). They control the

power/speed of the Comparator.

00:High speed

01 or 10:Medium speed

11:Ultra low power

fields.name: INMSEL
fields.desc:
INMSEL: Comparator input minus selection bits

These bits are set and cleared by software (only if LOCK not set). They select which input is

connected to the input minus of comparator.

000: 1/4 VREFINT

001: 1/2 VREFINT

010: 3/4VREFINT

011: VREFINT

100: DAC OUT

101: PA13

110: PB0

111: PB3

fields.name: INPSEL
fields.desc:
INPSEL[1:0]: Comparator input plus selection bit

This bit is set and cleared by software (only if LOCK not set).

00: PA14

01: PB1

1x: PB2

fields.name: POLARITY
fields.desc:
POLARITY: Comparator polarity selection bit

This bit is set and cleared by software (only if LOCK not set). It inverts Comparator polarity.

0: Comparator output value not inverted

1: Comparator output value inverted

fields.name: HYST
fields.desc:
HYST[1:0]: Comparator hysteresis selection bits

These bits are set and cleared by software (only if LOCK not set). They select the

Hysteresis voltage of the comparator .

00: No hysteresis

01: Low hysteresis

10: Medium hysteresis

11: High hysteresis

fields.name: BLANKING
fields.desc:
BLANKING[2:0]: Comparator blanking source selection bits

These bits select which timer output controls the comparator output blanking.

000: No blanking

001: TIM2 OC4 selected as blanking source

010: TIM16 OC1 selected as blanking source

All other values: reserved

fields.name: BRGEN
fields.desc:
BRGEN: Scaler bridge enable

This bit is set and cleared by software (only if LOCK not set). This bit enable the bridge of

the scaler.

0: Scaler resistor bridge disable

1: Scaler resistor bridge enable

If SCALEN is set and BRGEN is reset, BG voltage reference is available                                                                                                      but not 1/4BGAP, 1/2BGAP, 3/4 BGAP. BGAP value is sent instead of 1/4BGAP, 1/2BGAP, 3/4 BGAP.

If SCALEN and BRGEN are set, 1/4 BGAP 1/2BGAP 3/4BGAP and BGAP voltage

references are available.

fields.name: SCALEN
fields.desc:
SCALEN: Voltage scaler enable bit

This bit is set and cleared by software. This bit enable the outputs of the VREFINT divider

available on the minus input of the Comparator

0: scaler disable

1: scaler enable

fields.name: VALUE
fields.desc:
VALUE: Comparator output status bit

This bit is read-only. It reflects the current comparator output taking into account POLARITY

bit effect.

fields.name: LOCK
fields.desc:
LOCK: COMP_CSR register lock bit

This bit is set by software and cleared by a hardware system reset. It locks the whole

content of the comparator control register, COMP1_CSR[31:0].

0: COMP1_CSR[31:0] are read/write

1: COMP1_CSR[31:0] are read-only

fields.name: EN
fields.desc:
EN: DAC channel enable This bit is set and cleared by software to enable/disable DAC

channel.

0: DAC channel disabled

1: DAC channel enabled

fields.name: BON
fields.desc:
BON: DAC channel output buffer enable. This bit is set and cleared by software to

enable/disable DAC channel output buffer.

0: DAC channel output buffer disabled

1: DAC channel output buffer enabled

fields.name: TEN
fields.desc:
TEN: DAC channel trigger enable This bit is set and cleared by software to enable/disable

DAC channel trigger.

0: DAC channel trigger disabled and data written into the DAC_DHR register are transferred

       one APB0 clock cycle later to the DAC_DOR register

1: DAC channel trigger enabled and data from the DAC_DHR register are transferred three

       APB0 clock cycles later to the DAC_DOR register

Note: When software trigger is selected, the transfer from the DAC_DHR

register to the DAC_DOR register takes only one APB0 clock cycle.

fields.name: TSEL
fields.desc:
TSEL[2:0]: DAC channel trigger selection These bits select the external event used to trigger

DAC channel.

000: Timer 16 TRGO event

001: PA8 pin event from SYSCFG

010 to 011: Reserved

111: Software trigger

Only used if bit TEN = 1 (DAC channel trigger enabled).

fields.name: WAVE
fields.desc:
WAVE[1:0]: DAC channel noise/triangle wave generation enable These bits are set and

cleared by software.

00: wave generation disabled

01: Noise wave generation enabled

1x: Triangle wave generation enabled

Note: Only used if bit TEN = 1 (DAC channel trigger enabled).

fields.name: MAMP
fields.desc:
MAMP[3:0]: DAC channel mask amplitude selector These bits are written by software to

select mask in wave generation mode or amplitude in triangle generation mode.

0000: Unmask bit0 of LFSR  triangle amplitude equal to 1

0001: Unmask bits[1:0] of LFSR  triangle amplitude equal to 3

0010: Unmask bits[2:0] of LFSR  triangle amplitude equal to 7

0011: Unmask bits[3:0] of LFSR  triangle amplitude equal to 15

0100: Unmask bits[4:0] of LFSR  triangle amplitude equal to 31

greater than or equal to 0101: Unmask bits[5:0] of LFSR  triangle amplitude equal to 63

fields.name: DMAEN
fields.desc:
DMAEN: DAC channel DMA enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

0: DAC channel DMA mode disabled

1: DAC channel DMA mode enabled

fields.name: DMAUDRIE
fields.desc:
DMAUDRIE: DAC channel DMA Underrun Interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by

software.

0: DAC channel DMA Underrun Interrupt disabled

1: DAC channel DMA Underrun Interrupt enabled

fields.name: CMPEN
fields.desc:
CMPEN: DAC channel output to COMP INMINUS enable. This bit is set and cleared by

software.

0: DAC channel output to COMP INMINUS disabled

1: DAC channel output to COMP INMINUS enabled

fields.name: VCMEN
fields.desc:
VCMEN: DAC channel output to VCM BUFFER enable. This bit is set and cleared by

software.

0: DAC channel output to VCM BUFFER disabled

1: DAC channel output to VCM BUFFER enabled

fields.name: VCMON
fields.desc:
VCMON: VCMBUFF power-up. This bit is set and cleared by software.

0: VCM BUFFER OFF

1: VCM BUFFER ON

fields.name: SWTRIG
fields.desc:
SWTRIG: DAC channel software trigger This bit is set by software to enable/disable the

software trigger.

0: Software trigger disabled

1: Software trigger enabled

Note: This bit is cleared by hardware (one APB0 clock cycle later) once the

DAC_DHR register value has been loaded into the DAC_DOR register.

fields.name: DACDHR
fields.desc:
DACDHR[5:0]: DAC channel 6-bit data These bits are written by software which

specifies 6-bit data for DAC channel.

fields.name: DACDOR
fields.desc:
DACDOR[5:0]: DAC channel data output These bits are read-only, they contain data output

for DAC channel.

fields.name: DMAUDR
fields.desc:
DMAUDR: DAC channel DMA underrun flag This bit is set by hardware and cleared by

software (by writing it to 1).

0: No DMA underrun error condition occurred for DAC channel

1: DMA underrun error condition occurred for DAC channel (the currently selected trigger is

       driving DAC channel conversion at a frequency higher than the DMA service capability rate)

fields.name: DBG_SLEEP
fields.desc:
Allow debug of the CPU in SLEEP mode
- 0: Normal operation. All clocks will be disabled automatically in SLEEP mode
- 1: Automatic clock stop disabled. All active CPU clocks and oscillators will continue to run during SLEEP mode, allowing full CPU debug capability. On exit from SLEEP mode, the clock settings will be set to the SLEEP mode exit state.

fields.name: DBG_STOP
fields.desc:
Allow debug of the CPU in DEEPSTOP mode
- 0: Normal operation. All clocks will be disabled automatically in STOP mode
- 1: Automatic clock stop disabled. All active CPU clocks and oscillators will continue to run during STOP mode, allowing full CPU debug capability. On exit from STOP mode, the clock settings will be set to the STOP mode exit state.

fields.name: DBG_TIM2_STOP
fields.desc:
TIM2 stop in the CPU debug
- 0: Normal operation. TIM2 continues to operate while the CPU is in debug mode
- 1: Stop in debug. TIM2 is frozen while the CPU is in debug mode.

fields.name: DBG_TIM16_STOP
fields.desc:
TIM16 stop in the CPU debug
- 0: Normal operation. TIM16 continues to operate while the CPU is in debug mode
- 1: Stop in debug. TIM16 is frozen while the CPU is in debug mode.

fields.name: DBG_RTC_STOP
fields.desc:
RTC stop in CPU debug
- 0: Normal operation. RTC continues to operate while the CPU is in debug mode
- 1: Stop in debug. RTC is frozen while the CPU is in debug mode.

fields.name: DBG_IWDG_STOP
fields.desc:
IWDG stop in the CPU debug
- 0: Normal operation. IWDG continues to operate while the CPU is in debug mode
- 1: Stop in debug. IWDG is frozen while the CPU is in debug mode.

fields.name: DBG_I2C1_STOP
fields.desc:
I2C1 SMBUS timeout stop in CPU debug
- 0: Normal operation. I2C1 SMBUS timeout continues to operate while the CPU is in debug mode
- 1: Stop in debug. I2C1 SMBUS timeou is frozen while the CPU is in debug mode.

fields.name: DBG_I2C2_STOP
fields.desc:
I2C2 SMBUS timeout stop in CPU debug
- 0: Normal operation. I2C2 SMBUS timeout continues to operate while the CPU is in debug mode
- 1: Stop in debug. I2C2 SMBUS timeou is frozen while the CPU is in debug mode.

1: A TE, HT or TC event occurred on channel 1

fields.name: DIR

fields.name: NDT
fields.desc:
NDT[15:0]: Number of data to transfer

Number of data to be transferred (0 up to 65535). This register can only be written when the

channel is disabled. Once the channel is enabled, this register is read-only, indicating the

remaining bytes to be transmitted. This register decrements after each DMA transfer.

Once the transfer is completed, this register can either stay at zero or be reloaded

automatically by the value previously programmed if the channel is configured in auto-reload

mode.

If this register is zero, no transaction can be served whether the channel is enabled or not.

fields.name: PA
fields.desc:
PA[31:0]: Peripheral address

Base address of the peripheral data register from/to which the data will be read/written.

When PSIZE is 01 (16-bit), the PA[0] bit is ignored. Access is automatically aligned to a halfword

address.

When PSIZE is 10 (32-bit), PA[1:0] are ignored. Access is automatically aligned to a word

address.

fields.name: MA
fields.desc:
MA[31:0]: Memory address

Base address of the memory area from/to which the data will be read/written.

When MSIZE is 01 (16-bit), the MA[0] bit is ignored. Access is automatically aligned to a halfword

address.

When MSIZE is 10 (32-bit), MA[1:0] are ignored. Access is automatically aligned to a word

address.

fields.name: PCKTLEN
fields.desc: This bit field has different meanings/usages:

fields.name: DATARATE_M
fields.desc: The mantissa of the specified data rate (default: 38.

fields.name: DATARATE_E
fields.desc: The exponent of the specified data rate (default: 38.

fields.name: MOD_TYPE
fields.desc: Select the modulation type

fields.name: CONST_MAP
fields.desc: Also known as FOUR_GFSK_CONST_MAP

fields.name: BT_SEL
fields.desc: Select BT value for GFSK

fields.name: PA_CLKON_LOCKONTX
fields.desc: Enable the clock on analog PA in LOCKONTX state

fields.name: FDEV_M
fields.desc: Mantissa of the frequency deviation (default: 28.

fields.name: FDEV_E
fields.desc: Exponent of the frequency deviation (default: 28.

fields.name: CHFLT_M
fields.desc: Mantissa of the channel filter BW (default: 100 kHz)

fields.name: CHFLT_E
fields.desc: Exponent of the channel filter BW (default: 100 kHz)

fields.name: SYNTH_FRAC
fields.desc: Fractional part of the  PLL fractional divide factor (default: 868 MHz, XTAL: 48 MHz)

fields.name: SYNTH_INT
fields.desc: PLL integer divide factor (default: 868 MHz, XTAL: 48 MHz)

fields.name: BS
fields.desc: Synthesizer band selector, i.

fields.name: VCO_CALAMP_EXT
fields.desc: VCO magnitude calibration word in thermometric code

fields.name: VCO_CALAMP_EXT_SEL
fields.desc: Select the mode to provide an external VCO amplitude calibration value through VCO_CALAMP_EXT bit field

fields.name: VCO_CALFREQ_EXT
fields.desc: VCO Cbank frequency calibration word.

fields.name: VCO_CALFREQ_EXT_SEL
fields.desc: Select the mode to provide an external VCO frequency calibration value through VCO_CALFREQ_EXT bit field

fields.name: VCO_CALIB_REQ
fields.desc: Define if the Radio FSM must launch a VCO calibration request after VCO start-up

fields.desc: RX timer timeout (relative duration in interpolated absolute time unit)

fields.name: RX_SQI_TIMEOUT_MASK
fields.desc: - 0: SYNC valid flag does not contribute to timeout disabling

fields.name: RX_OR_nAND_SELECT

fields.name: RX_ALMOST_FULL_THR

fields.name: TX_ALMOST_EMPTY_THR

fields.desc: Fast RX termination timer value (corresponding to the delay to measure the RSSI and to let the HW check CS flag information)

fields.name: FAST_CS_TERM_EN
fields.desc: Enable the Fast RX Termination feature

fields.name: COMMAND_ID
fields.desc: Opcode coresponding to a command:

fields.name: BACK2ACTIVE
fields.desc: Select the default/return state for the Radio FSM to be ACTIVE2

fields.name: BACK2LOCKON
fields.desc: Request to the Radio FSM to stay in LOCKON state when exiting a RX or a TX

fields.name: COMMAND
fields.desc:
Macro commands for flash operations (may require DATA0...DATA3 to be set):
- 0x11 : ERASE
- 0x22 : MASSERASE
- 0x33 : WRITE
- 0x55 : MASSREAD
- 0xAA : SLEEP
- 0xBB : WAKEUP
- 0xCC : BURSTWRITE
- 0xEE : OTPWRITE
- 0xFF : KEYWRITE

fields.name: REMAP
fields.desc:
CPU access routing (it supersedes PREMAP configuration):
- 0 : FLASH memory addressed
- 1 : SRAM0 memory addressed

fields.name: DIS_GROUP_WRITE
fields.desc:
Burst write Control:
- 0 : burst write allowed
- 1 : burst write forbidden

fields.name: WAIT_STATE
fields.desc:
Add latency to flash read opeations:
- 00 : no latency
- 01 : 1 clock cycle latency
- 10 : 2 clock cycles latency
- 11 : 3 clock cycles latency

fields.name: SLEEP_SM
fields.desc:
Flash memory power-down mode enable in SLEEP mode
This bit allows to have the Flash memory in power-down mode or in idle mode when the
device is in Sleep mode.
- 0: When the device is in Sleep mode, the NVM is in Idle mode.
- 1: When the device is in Sleep mode, the NVM is in power-down mode.

fields.name: CMDDONE_MIS
fields.desc: (1: clear, 0: inactive) CMDDONE_MIS flag

fields.name: CMDSTART_MIS
fields.desc: (1: clear, 0: inactive) CMDSTART_MIS flag

fields.name: CMDBUSYERR_MIS
fields.desc: (1: clear, 0: inactive) CMDBUSYERR_MIS flag

fields.name: ILLCMD_MIS
fields.desc: (1: clear, 0: inactive) ILLCMD_MIS flag

fields.name: READOK_MIS

fields.name: FNREADY_MIS
fields.desc: (1: clear, 0: inactive) FNREADY_MIS flag

fields.name: CMDDONEM
fields.desc: (1: mask, 0: inactive) CMDDONE_MIS mask

fields.name: CMDSTARTM
fields.desc: (1: mask, 0: inactive) CMDSTART_MIS mask

fields.name: CMDBUSYERRM
fields.desc: (1: mask, 0: inactive) CMDBUSYERR_MIS mask

fields.name: ILLCMDM
fields.desc: (1: mask, 0: inactive) ILLCMD_MIS mask

fields.name: READOKM
fields.desc: (1: mask, 0: inactive) READOK_MIS mask

fields.name: FNREADYM
fields.desc: (1: mask, 0: inactive) FNREADY_MIS mask

fields.name: CMDDONE_RIS
fields.desc: (1: active, 0: inactive) COMMAND sequence ended

fields.name: CMDSTART_RIS
fields.desc: (1: active, 0: inactive) COMMAND sequence started

fields.name: CMDBUSYERR_RIS
fields.desc: (1: active, 0: inactive) COMMAND issued while flash busy

fields.name: ILLCMD_RIS
fields.desc: (1: active, 0: inactive) Illegal command issued

fields.name: READOK_RIS
fields.desc: (1: active, 0: inactive) READ COMMAND completed successfully

fields.name: CMDSLEEPERR_RIS
fields.desc: (1: active, 0: inactive) COMMAND issued while flash in sleep-mode (SLM=1)

fields.name: FLASH_SIZE
fields.desc:
Maximum valid address for flash memory:
- 00 : 0x03FFF (64kb)
- 01 : 0x07FFF (128kb)
- 10 : 0x0BFFF (192kb)
- 11 : 0x0FFFF (256kb)

fields.name: RAM_SIZE
fields.desc:
RAM memory size selection:
- 0 : 16kb
- 1 : 32kb

fields.name: FLASH_SECURE
fields.desc: Flash memory protection (0: no key present, 1: key present)

fields.name: JTAG_DISABLE
fields.desc: Flash+JTAG protection (0: no JTAG protection - see FLASH_SECURE, 1: Flash and JTAG protected)

fields.name: PACKAGE_SIZE
fields.desc:
Package selection:
- 0- : CSP
- 10 : 32pins
- 11 : 48pins

fields.name: YADDR
fields.desc: Flash column address offset to be used with some COMMAND

fields.name: XADDR
fields.desc: Flash row address offset to be used with some COMMAND

fields.name: LFSRVAL
fields.desc: Flash read data CRC signature

fields.name: SEGSIZE0
fields.desc: First segment, 7-bit page protection size (number of pages to protect in segment, first page included)

fields.name: SEGOFFSET0
fields.desc: First segment, 7-bit page protection offset (first page number in protected segment)

fields.name: SEGSIZE1
fields.desc: Second segment, 7-bit page protection size (number of pages to protect in segment, first page included)

fields.name: SEGOFFSET1
fields.desc: Second segment, 7-bit page protection offset (first page number in protected segment)

fields.name: SEGSIZE2
fields.desc: Third segment, 7-bit page protection size (number of pages to protect in segment, first page included)

fields.name: SEGOFFSET2
fields.desc: Third segment, 7-bit page protection offset (first page number in protected segment)

fields.name: SEGSIZE3
fields.desc: Fourth segment, 7-bit page protection size (number of pages to protect in segment, first page included)

fields.name: SEGOFFSET3
fields.desc: Fourth segment, 7-bit page protection offset (first page number in protected segment)

fields.desc: (NOT TO BE DOCUMENTED) Remove read-write protection from IFR3 sector

fields.name: LCK0
fields.desc:
LCK0: Port A lock bit 0
These bits are read/write but can only be written when the LCKK bit is 0, using the specific
sequence described in LCKK bit description.
-0: Port configuration not locked
-1: Port configuration locked

fields.name: LCKK
fields.desc:
LCKK: Lock key
This bit can be read any time. It can only be modified using the lock key write sequence.
-0: Port configuration lock key not active
-1: Port configuration lock key active. The GPIOx_LCKR register is locked until the next MCU
reset or peripheral reset.
LOCK key write sequence:
WR LCKR[16] = 1 + LCKR[15:0]
WR LCKR[16] = 0 + LCKR[15:0]
WR LCKR[16] = 1 + LCKR[15:0]
RD LCKR
RD LCKR[16] = 1 (this read operation is optional but it confirms that the lock is active)
Note: During the LOCK key write sequence, the value of LCK[15:0] must not change.
Any error in the lock sequence aborts the lock.
After the first lock sequence on any bit of the port, any read access on the LCKK bit will
return 1 until the next MCU reset or peripheral reset

fields.name: AFSEL0
fields.desc:
y[3:0]: Alternate function selection for port A pin y (y = 0..7)
These bits are written by software to configure alternate function I/Os
AFSELy selection:
-0000: AF0
-0001: AF1
-0010: AF2
-0011: AF3
-0100: AF4
-0101: AF5
-0110: AF6
-0111: AF7
1xxx: Reserved

fields.name: BR0

sequence described in LCKK bit description.

-1: Port configuration locked

This bit can be read any time. It can only be modified using the lock key write sequence.
-0: Port configuration lock key not active
-1: Port configuration lock key active. The GPIOx_LCKR register is locked until the next MCU
reset or peripheral reset.
LOCK key write sequence:
WR LCKR[16] = 1 + LCKR[15:0]
WR LCKR[16] = 0 + LCKR[15:0]
WR LCKR[16] = 1 + LCKR[15:0]
RD LCKR
RD LCKR[16] = 1 (this read operation is optional but it confirms that the lock is active)
Note: During the LOCK key write sequence, the value of LCK[15:0] must not change.
Any error in the lock sequence aborts the lock.
After the first lock sequence on any bit of the port, any read access on the LCKK bit will
return 1 until the next MCU reset or peripheral reset

fields.name: BR0
fields.desc:
BR0: Port B reset bit y (y = 0..15)
These bits are write-only. A read to these bits returns the value 0x0000.
-0: No action on the corresponding ODx bit
-1: Resets the corresponding ODx bit
