fields.name: LPMS
fields.desc:
LPMS Low Power Mode Selection
Selection of the low power mode entered when CPU enters DEEP SLEEP mode and BLE is rdy2sleep.
- 0: Deep Stop mode (default)
- 1: Shutdown mode

fields.name: ENSDNBOR
fields.desc:
ENSDNBOR: Enable BOR supply monitoring during shutdown mode.
- 1: the PD_ALL_SHUTDOWN signal is not set during SHUTDOWN mode
- 0: the PD_ALL_SHUTDOWN signal is set during SHUTDOWN mode.

fields.name: IBIAS_RUN_AUTO
fields.desc:
IBIAS_RUN_AUTO: Enable automatic IBIAS control during RUN/DEEPSTOP mode.
- 0: IBIAS control is manual (and controlled by IBIAS_RUN_STATE register)
- 1: IBIAS control is automatic (default).

fields.name: IBIAS_RUN_STATE
fields.desc:
IBIAS_RUN_STATE: Enable/Disable IBIAS during RUN mode when automatic mode is
disabled.
- 0: IBIAS control is disabled (default).
- 1: IBIAS control is enabled.

fields.name: APC
fields.desc:
APC Apply Pull-up and pull-down configuration from CPU
- 1: the I/O pull-up and pull-down configurations defined in the PUCRx and PDCRx registers is applied.
- 0: the PUCRx and PDCRx are not used to control the I/O pull-up and pull-down configuration of the product I/Os.

fields.name: ENBORH
fields.desc:
ENBORH: enable BORH configuration
- 1: BORH is enabled, threshold level depends on SELBOR[1:0]
- 0: BORH off (VBOR0):  threshold level for above 1.60V voltage operation.

fields.name: SELBORH
fields.desc:
SELBORH[1:0]: BORH selection of Vbor threshold
- 11: BORH Level 4(VBOR4):  threshold level for above 2.81 V voltage operation.
- 10: BORH Level 3 (VBOR3):  threshold level for above 2.52 V voltage operation
- 01: BORH Level 2 (VBOR2):  threshold level for above 2.21 V voltage operation
- 00: BORH Level 1 (VBOR1):  threshold level for above 2.0V voltage operation.

fields.name: ENBORL
fields.desc:
ENBORL: Enable BORL reset supervising during RUN mode.
- 0: No BORL is monitored during RUN mode.
- 1: BORL is monitored during RUN mode (a POR reset will happen if VDDIO goes below 1.6V during RUN mode) (default).
Note: Enabling this feature prevents blocking the device if VDDIO goes below supported voltages during RUN.

fields.name: PVDE
fields.desc:
PVDE Programmable Voltage Detector Enable
When this bit is set the Power Voltage Detector is enabled

fields.name: PVDLS
fields.desc:
PVDLS[2:0] Programmable Voltage Detector Level selection
- 000: 2.05 V - Lowest level
- 001: 2.20 V
- 010: 2.36 V
- 011: 2.52 V
- 100: 2.64 V
- 101: 2.81 V
- 110: 2.91 V - Highest level
- 111: External input analog voltage (compare internally to VBGP; When external input  VBGP
then PVDO=1)

fields.name: DBGRET
fields.desc:
DBGRET: PA2 and PA3 retention enable after DEEPSTOP
- 0: PA2, PA3 don't retain their status exiting from DEEPSTOP (default).
- 1: PA2, PA3 retain their status exiting from DEEPSTOP.

fields.name: RAMRET1
fields.desc:
RAMRET1: RAM1 retention during low power mode
- 1: RAM1 bank is powered during low power mode
- 0: RAM1 bank is disabled during low power mode (by default)

fields.name: LPREG_FORCE_VH
fields.desc:
force LPREG=1.2V during DEEPSTOP
- 1: Force LPREG=1.2V during DEEPSTOP
- 0: No Force (Default)
Note LPREG= 1.2v can still apply when LCDEN or COMP.SCALEREN request it

fields.name: LPREG_VH_STATUS
fields.desc:
status LPREG VH (1.2v) during DEEPSTOP
- 1: LPREG=1.2V during DEEPSTOP
- 0: LPREG=1V during DEEPSTOP

fields.name: GPIORET
fields.desc:
GPIORET: GPIO retention enable.
- 0: Release GPIO retention after deepstop (Should be reset after restore Context)
- 1: Enable GPIO Retention during deepstop (Must be set before deepstop)

fields.name: ENTS
fields.desc:
ENTS: Enable Temperature Sensor
- 1: Temperature sensor is enabled
- 0: Temperature sensor is disabled

fields.name: RFREGEN
fields.desc:
RFREGEN: RF Regulator Enable
- 1: Enable RF Regulator
- 0: Disable RF Regulator (Note: RF Regulator can still be enabled by the RFSUGB or RCC_CR.HSEON)

fields.name: RFREGCEXT
fields.desc:
RFREGCEXT: RF Regulator External Supply Bypass
- 1: External supply bypass capability
- 0: Internal supply only

fields.name: RFREGBYP
fields.desc:
RFREGBYP: RF Regulator Bypass Enable
- 1: LDO output connected to VSMPS.
- 0: internally generated 1.2V

fields.name: RFREGRDY
fields.desc:
RFDREGRDY: RF Regulator Ready flag
- 1: RF Regulator is ready
- 0: RF Regulator is not ready

fields.name: RFREGON_STATUS
fields.desc:
RFREGON_STATUS:  RF Regulator On Status
- 1:  RF Regulator is enabled
- 0:  RF Regulator is disabled

fields.name: EIWL0
fields.desc:
EWL0 Enable Internal WakeUp line LPUART
When this bit is set the internal wakeup line is enabled and a rising edge will trigger a CPU wakeup event.
- 0: wakeup disabled.
- 1: wakeup enabled.

fields.name: EIWL1
fields.desc:
EIWL1 Enable Internal WakeUp line RTC
When this bit is set the internal wakeup line is enabled and a rising edge will trigger a CPU wakeup event.
- 0: wakeup disabled.
- 1: wakeup enabled.

fields.name: EIWL2
fields.desc:
EIWL2 Enable Internal WakeUp line LCD
When this bit is set the internal wakeup line is enabled and a rising edge will trigger a CPU wakeup event.
- 0: wakeup disabled.
- 1: wakeup enabled.

fields.name: EIWL3
fields.desc:
EIWL3 Enable Internal Wakeup line COMP
When this bit is set the COMP wakeup is enabled and an  edge will trigger a COMP wakeup event
- 0: wakeup disabled.
- 1: wakeup enabled.

fields.name: EIWL4
fields.desc:
EIWL4 Enable Internal Wakeup line LCSC
When this bit is set the LCSC wakeup is enabled and an  edge will trigger a LCSC wakeup event
- 0: wakeup disabled.
- 1: wakeup enabled.

fields.name: EWMRSUBG
fields.desc:
EWMRSUB Wakeup MRSUBG Enable
When this bit is set the MRSUBG wakeup is enabled and a rising edge will trigger a MRSUBG wakeup event
- 0: MRSUBG wakeup disabled.
- 1: MRSUBG wakeup enabled.

fields.name: EWMRSUBGHCPU
fields.desc:
EWMRSUBGHCPU Wakeup MRSUBG Host CPU Enable
When this bit is set the MRSUBG HOST CPU wakeup is enabled and a rising edge will trigger a MRSUBG Host CPU wakeup event
- 0: MRSUBG Host CPU wakeup disabled.
- 1: MRSUBG Host CPU wakeup enabled.

fields.name: EWLPAWUR
fields.desc:
EWLPAWUR: Wakeup Bubble Enable
When this bit is set the Bubble wakeup is enabled and a rising edge will trigger a LPAWUR wakeup event
- 0: LPAWUR wakeup disabled.
- 1: LPAWUR wakeup enabled.

fields.name: IWUP0
fields.desc:
IWUP0: Wakeup polarity for internal wakeup line 0 event (LPUART).
- 0: Detection of wakeup event on rising edge (default).
- 1: Detection of wakeup event on falling edge.

fields.name: IWUP1
fields.desc:
IWUP1: Wakeup polarity for internal wakeup line 1 event (RTC).
- 0: Detection of wakeup event on rising edge (default).
- 1: Detection of wakeup event on falling edge.

fields.name: IWUP2
fields.desc:
IWUP2: Wakeup polarity for internal wakeup line 2 event (LCD).
- 0: Detection of wakeup event on rising edge (default).
- 1: Detection of wakeup event on falling edge.

fields.name: IWUP3
fields.desc:
IWUP3: Wakeup polarity for internal wakeup line 3 event (COMP).
- 0: Detection of wakeup event on rising edge (default).
- 1: Detection of wakeup event on falling edge.

fields.name: IWUP4
fields.desc:
IWUP4: Wakeup polarity for internal wakeup line 4 event (LCSC).
- 0: Detection of wakeup event on rising edge (default).
- 1: Detection of wakeup event on falling edge.

fields.name: WMRSUBGHP
fields.desc:
WMRSUBGHP: Wakeup polarity for internal wakeup MRSUBG event
- 0: Detection of wakeup event on rising edge (default).
- 1: Detection of wakeup event on falling edge.

fields.name: WMRSUBGHCPUP
fields.desc:
WMRSUBGHCPUP: Wakeup polarity for internal wakeup MRSUBG Host CPU event
- 0: Detection of wakeup event on rising edge (default).
- 1: Detection of wakeup event on falling edge.

fields.name: WLPAWURP
fields.desc:
WLPAWURP: Wakeup polarity for wakeup LPAWUR event.
- 0: Detection of wakeup event on rising edge (default).
- 1: Detection of wakeup event on falling edge.

fields.name: IWUF0
fields.desc:
IWUF0: Internal wakeup flag (LPUART).
- 0: no wakeup from LPUART occurred since last clear.
- 1: a wakeup from LPUART occurred since last clear.
Cleared by writing 1 in this bit.

fields.name: IWUF1
fields.desc:
IWUF1: Internal wakeup flag (RTC).
- 0: no wakeup from RTC occurred since last clear.
- 1: a wakeup from RTC occurred

fields.name: IWUF2
fields.desc:
IWUF2: Internal wakeup flag (LCD).
- 0: no wakeup from LCD occurred since last clear.
- 1: a wakeup from LCD occurred since last clear.
Cleared by writing 1 in this bit.

fields.name: IWUF3
fields.desc:
IWUF3: Internal wakeup flag (COMP).
- 0: no wakeup from COMP occurred since last clear.
- 1: a wakeup from COMP occurred since last clear.
Cleared by writing 1 in this bit.

fields.name: IWUF4
fields.desc:
IWUF4: Internal wakeup flag (LCSC).
- 0: no wakeup from LCSC occurred since last clear.
- 1: a wakeup from LCSC occurred since last clear.
Cleared by writing 1 in this bit.

fields.name: WMRSUBGF
fields.desc:
WMRSUBGF Wakeup MRSUBG Flag
This bit is set by hardware when a MRSUBG wakeup is detected
It is cleared by a reset pad or by software writing 1 in this bit field.
- 0: No MRSUBG Wakeup detected
- 1: MRSUBG Wakeup detected
writting 1 in this bit, clears the interrupt

fields.name: WMRSUBGHCPUF
fields.desc:
WMRSUBGHCPUF Wakeup MRSUBG HOST CPU Flag (cf. user manual)
This bit is set by hardware when a MRSUBG HOST CPU wakeup is detected
It is cleared by a reset pad or by software writing 1 in this bit field.
- 0: No MRSUBG Host CPU wakeup detected
- 1: MRSUBG Host CPU wakeup detected
writting 1 in this bit, clears the interrupt

fields.name: WLPAWURF
fields.desc:
WLPAWURF Wakeup LPAWUR Flag (cf. user manual)
This bit is set by hardware when a LPAWUR wakeup is detected
It is cleared by a reset pad or by software writing 1 in this bit field.
- 0: No LPAWUR wakeup detected
- 1: LPAWUR wakeup detected
writting 1 in this bit, clears the interrupt

fields.name: SMPSBYPR
fields.desc:
SMPSBYPR: SMPS Force Bypass Control Replica
This bit mirrors the actual BYPASS_3V3 control signal driven to the SMPS regulator, dependant on the real working state.

fields.name: SMPSENR
fields.desc:
SMPSENR: SMPS Enable Control Replica
This bit mirrors the actual ENABLE_3V3 control signal driven to the SMPS regulator, dependant on the real working state.

fields.name: SMPSRDY
fields.desc:
SMPSRDY: SMPS Ready Status
This bit provides the information whether SMPS is ready.
- 0: SMPS regulator is not ready
- 1: SMPS regulator is ready.

fields.name: IOBOOTVAL2
fields.desc:
Bit3: PB15  input value on VDD33 latched at POR
Bit2: PB14  input value on VDD33 latched at POR
Bit1: PB13  input value on VDD33 latched at POR
Bit0: PB12 input value on VDD33 latched at POR

fields.name: REGLPS
fields.desc:
REGLPS: Regulator Low Power Started
This bit provides the information whether low power regulator is ready.
- 0: LP regulator is not ready.
- 1: LP regulator is ready.

fields.name: REGMS
fields.desc:
REGMS: Main regulator ready status.
- 0: The Main regulator is not ready.
- 1: The Main regulator is ready.

fields.name: PVDO
fields.desc:
PVDO: Power Voltage Detector Output
When the Power Voltage Detector is enabled (CR2.PVDE) this bit is set when the system supply (VDDIO) is
lower than the selected PVD threshold (CR2.PVDLS)

fields.name: IOBOOTVAL
fields.desc:
Bit3: PA11  input value on VDD33 latched at POR
Bit2: PA10  input value on VDD33 latched at POR
Bit1: PA9  input value on VDD33 latched at POR
Bit0: PA8 input value on VDD33 latched at POR

fields.name: SMPSLVL
fields.desc:
SMPSLVL[3:0] SMPS Output Level Voltage Selection
Select the SMPS output voltage with a granularity of 50mV. Default = '0100' (1.4V)
Vout = 1.2 + 0.05*SMPSOUT (V)

fields.name: SMPSBOMSEL
fields.desc:
SMPSBOMSEL: SMPS BOM Selection:
- 00: BOM1
- 01: BOM2 (default)
- 10: BOM3
- 11: n/a

fields.name: SMPS_BOF_STATIC
fields.desc:
SMPS_BOF_STATIC: SMPS Bypass on the Fly static
- 0 : disabled (by default)
- 1 : SMPS Bypass on  the fly static is enabled (EN_SW=1)

fields.name: NOSMPS_BOF
fields.desc:
NOSMPS_BOF: No SMPS Mode to be used in accordance to SMPS_BOF_STATIC =1
When this bit is set, the SMPS regulator will be disabled. Note that this configuration should be used only SMPS_BOF_STATIC=1.
- 0 : No effect, SMPS is enabled. (default)
- 1 : SMPS is disabled;

fields.name: SMPSLPOPEN
fields.desc:
SMPSLPOPEN: In Low Power mode SMPS is in OPEN mode (instead of PRECHARGE mode).
When this bit is set, when the chip is in Low power mode the SMPS regulator will be disabled (HZ) Documentation needed.
- 0 : in Low Power mode, SMPS is in PRECHARGE, output is connected to VDDIO. (default)
- 1 : in Low Power mode, SMPS is disabled, output is floating

fields.name: SMPSFBYP
fields.desc:
SMPSFB Force SMPS Regulator in bypass mode
When this bit is set, the SMPS regulator will be forced to operate in precharge mode. the actual state of  SMPS can be observed thanks to the replica SR2.SMPSBYPR.
- 0 : no effect (by default)
- 1 : SMPS is disabled and bypassed (ENABLE_3V3=0 and PRECHARGE_3V3=1)

fields.name: NOSMPS
fields.desc:
NOSMPS: No SMPS Mode
When this bit is set, the SMPS regulator will be disabled. Note that this configuration should be used only when SMPS_FB pad is directly connected to VBATT or Vext, without L/C BOM.
- 0 : No effect, SMPS is enabled. (Default)
- 1 : SMPS is disabled;

fields.name: SMPS_ENA_DCM
fields.desc:
SMPS_ENA_DCM: enable discontinuous conduction mode
- 0 : disable (Default)
- 1 : enable

fields.name: CLKDETR_DISABLE
fields.desc:
CLKDETR_DISABLE: disable SMPS clock detection
The SMPS clock detection enables an automatic SMPS bypass switching in case of unwanted loss of SMPS clock.
- 0 : SMPS clock detection enabled (default)
- 1 : SMPS clock detection disabled

fields.name: SMPS_PRECH_CUR_SEL
fields.desc:
SMPS_PRECH_CUR_SEL[1:0] Selection for SMPS PRECHARGE limit current
- 00: 2.5mA
- 01: 5mA
- 10: 10mA
- 11: 20mA (default)

fields.name: SMPS_BOF_DYN
fields.desc:
SMPS_BOF_DYN: SMPS Bypass on the Fly dynamic
- 0 : disabled (by default)
- 1 : SMPS Bypass on  the fly dynamic is enabled (EN_LDO=1)

fields.name: PUA
fields.desc:
PUA[x] : Pull Up Port A
Pull up activation on port A[i] pad when APC bit of PWRC CR1 is set
- 1: Pull-Up activated on port A[i] when APC bit of PWRC CR1 bit is set and PWR_PDCRA[x] is reset
- 0: Pull-Up not activated on port A[i]

fields.name: PDA
fields.desc:
PDA[x]: Pull Down Port A
Pull Down activation on port A[i] pad when APC bit of PWRC CR1 is set
- 1: Pull-Down activated on Port A[i] when APC bit of PWRC CR1 bit is set
- 0: Pull-Down not activated on Port A[i]

fields.name: PUB
fields.desc:
PUB[x] : Pull Up Port B
Pull up activation on port B[i] pad when APC bit of PWRC CR1 is set
- 1: Pull-Up activated on port B[i] when APC bit of PWRC CR1 bit is set and PWR_PDCRB[x] is reset
- 0: Pull-Up not activated on port B[i]

fields.name: PDB
fields.desc:
PDB[x]: Pull Down Port B
Pull Down activation on port B[i] pad when APC bit of PWRC CR1 is set
- 1: Pull-Down activated on Port B[i] when APC bit of PWRC CR1 bit is set
- 0: Pull-Down not activated on Port B[i]

fields.name: EWUA
fields.desc:
EWUA[x] Enable WakeUp line PA[x]
When this bit is set the PA[x] wakeup line is enabled and a rising or falling edge on wakeup line PA[x] will trigger a CPU wakeup event depending on CR7.WUPA[x] bit.

fields.name: WUPA
fields.desc:
WUPA[x] Wake-up Line PA[x] Polarity
This bit defines the polarity used for event detection on external wake-up line PA[x]
- 0: Detection on high level (rising edge)
- 1: Detection on low level (falling edge)

fields.name: WUFA
fields.desc:
WUFA[x] WakeUp Flag PA[x]
This bit is set when a wakeup is detected on wakeup line PA[x]. It is cleared by a reset pad or by writing 1 in this bit field.
Writing 1 this bit, clears the interrupt:

fields.name: EWUB
fields.desc:
EWUB[x] Enable WakeUp line PB[x]
When this bit is set the PB[x] wakeup line is enabled and a rising or falling edge on wakeup line PB[x] will trigger a CPU wakeup event depending on CR9.WUPB[x] bit.

fields.name: WUPB
fields.desc:
WUPB[x] Wake-up Line PB[x] Polarity
This bit defines the polarity used for event detection on external wake-up line PB[x]
- 0: Detection on high level (rising edge)
- 1: Detection on low level (falling edge)

fields.name: WUFB
fields.desc:
WUFB[x] WakeUp Flag PB[x]
This bit is set when a wakeup is detected on wakeup line PB[x]. It is cleared by a reset pad or by writing 1 in this bit field.
Writing 1 this bit, clears the interrupt:

fields.name: WUEN
fields.desc:
WUEN PB0 I/O WakeUp from shutdown Enable
When this bit is set the PB0 wakeup from shutdown is enabled so that a rising or falling edge on PB0 (depending on SDWN_WUPOL..WUPOL bit) will trigger a CPU wakeup. It is cleared by a PORESETn.
- 0: PB0 wakeup from shutdown disabled
- 1: PB0 wakeup from shutdown enabled

fields.name: WUPOL
fields.desc:
WUPOL PB0 I/O WakeUp from shutdown Polarity
This bit defines the polarity used for wakeup from shutdown detection on PB0 pin. It is cleared by a PORESETn.
- 0: Detection on high level  (rising edge)
- 1: Detection on low level  (falling edge)

fields.name: WUF
fields.desc:
WUF PB0 I/O WakeUp from shutdown Flag
This bit is set when a wakeup from shutdown is detected on PB0 pin.  It is cleared by a PORESETn or by writing 0 in this bit field.
- 0: Shutdown wakeup from PB0 not occurred
- 1: Shutdown wakeup from PB0 occurred

fields.name: BOF_TUNE
fields.desc:
BOF_TUNE:  selection of the Bypass on the Fly LDO output voltage.
- 0:	1.2V
- 1:	1.2V
- 2:	1.2V
- 3:	1.3V
- 4:	1.4V (Default)
- 5:	1.5V
- 6:	1.6V
- 7:	1.7V
- 8:	1.8V
- 9:	1.9V
- 10:	2V
- 11:	2.1V
- 12:	2.2V
- 13:	2.3V
- 14:	2.4V
- 15:	2.4V

fields.name: DEEPSTOP2
fields.desc:
DEEPSTOP2 low power saving mode emulation enable
this bit enable an emulated debug DEEPSTOP low power mode.
If emulation is enabled, entering in DEEPSTOP mode, the v12i power domain still enters power saving mode, but its clock and power are maintained.

fields.name: SMPSFRDY
fields.desc:
SMPSFB Force ready check
When this bit is set, the SMPS regulator will be forced to operate in precharge mode. the actual state of  SMPS can be observed thanks to the replica SR2.SMPSBYPR.
- 0 : no effect (by default)
- 1 : SMPS is disabled and bypassed (ENABLE_3V3=0 and PRECHARGE_3V3=1)

fields.name: KELVIN_TEST
fields.desc:
KELVIN_TEST[2:0]: Enable TEST mode Kelvin for LDO_RF (Write protected by IFR3 key)
- 000: 0mA (open) (default 0x0)
- 001 for 1mA
- 010 for 3mA
- 011 for 5mA
- 100 for 8mA
- 101 for 10mA
else: 0mA (open) for other combinations.

fields.name: DIS_PRECH
fields.desc:
DIS_PRECH[2:0]: disable precharge during deepstop (debug)
allowed combination are:
- 111: precharge and SMPS monitoring are disabled (whatever CR5.SMPSLPOPEN)
- 101: precharge are activated only at deepstop exit (to be used only with CR5.SMPSLPOPEN=1)
else: No effect (default 0x0)

fields.name: DEEPSTOPF
fields.desc:
DEEPSTOPF System DeepStop Flag
This bit is set by hardware and cleared only by a POR reset or by writing '1' in this bit field
- 0: System has not been in DEEPSTOP mode
- 1: System has been in DEEPSTOP mode

fields.name: RFPHASEF
fields.desc:
RFPHASEF RFPHASE Flag
This bit is set by hardware after a S3LP wake-up event (S3LP activation); it
is cleared either by software, writing '1' in this bit field, or by hardware when Ready2Sleep signal is asserted by the Radio IP.
- 0: RF IP does not require attention
- 1: RF IP awake and requesting system attention

fields.name: TESTDIG
fields.desc: TESTDIG: SMPS TEST_DIG_3V3[3:0] SMPS control signal

fields.name: TESTKEL
fields.desc: TESTKEL: SMPS TEST_KEL_3V3[1:0] SMPS control signal

fields.name: HOT_STUP
fields.desc: HOT_STUP_3V3 SMPS control signal

fields.name: NO_STUP
fields.desc: NO_STUP_3V3 SMPS control signal

fields.name: TESTILIM
fields.desc: TESTILIM: SMPS TEST_ILIM_3V3 SMPS control signal

fields.name: CTLRES_RAMP
fields.desc: CTLRES_RAM_3V3 SMPS control signal

fields.name: DIS_BIG_MOS
fields.desc: DIS_BIG_MOS_3V3 SMPS control signal

fields.name: TEST_OL
fields.desc: TEST_OL_3V3 SMPS control signal

fields.name: DIS_ILIM
fields.desc: DIS_ILIM_3V3 SMPS control signal

fields.name: ILIM_BOOST
fields.desc:
ILIM_BOOST_3V3 SMPS current limitation Boost
- 0: Max current = 110mA (Default)
- 1: Max current = 130mA

fields.name: BOF_CUR_SEL
fields.desc:
BOF_CUR_SEL Bypass On the Fly current limitation
- 00 : 20mA
- 01 : 40mA
- 10 : 60mA (default)
- 11 : no limit

fields.name: RFD_REG_TRIM
fields.desc:
RFD_REG_TRIM[2:0]: RF LDO Trimming
By default, this value is taken from the engi bytes; and saved on V12o domain when OBL done.
if associated ENGTRIM is enabled the RF LDO trimming can be controlled by the dedicated ENGTRIM register. Default= '100'.

fields.name: TRIM_MR
fields.desc:
TRIM_MR[3:0]: Main Regulator Voltage Trimming
By default, this value is taken from the engi bytes; and saved on V12o domain when OBL done.
if associated ENGTRIM.TRIMMREN is enabled the Main Regulator Voltage can be controlled by the dedicated ENGTRIM.TRIM_MR register. Default= '0000'.

fields.name: SMPS_TRIM
fields.desc:
SMPS_TRIM[2:0]: SMPS Output Voltage Trimming
By default, this value is taken from the engi bytes; and saved on V12o domain when OBL done.
if associated ENGTRIM is enabled the SMPS output voltage can be controlled by the dedicated ENGTRIM register. Default= '011'.

fields.name: BOF_TRIM
fields.desc:
BOF_TRIM[2:0]: Bypass On the Fly Output Voltage Trimming
By default, this value is taken from the engi bytes; and saved on V12o domain when OBL done.
if associated ENGTRIM is enabled the SMPS output voltage can be controlled by the dedicated ENGTRIM register. Default= '100'.

fields.name: TRIMRFDREGEN
fields.desc:
TRIMRFDREGEN: trimming RFREG enabled
- 1: trimming bit applied from ENGTRIM register
- 0: trimming bit applied from OBL (can be read on TRIMR register)

fields.name: TRIM_RFDREG
fields.desc:
TRIM_RFDREG:  RF Regulator Trimming
By default, this value is not applied, but taken from the engi bytes; if ENGTRIM.TRIMRFDREGEN=1, the startup current can be controlled by this register.

fields.name: TRIMMREN
fields.desc:
TRIMMREN: trimming MR enabled
- 1: trimming bit applied from ENGTRIM register
- 0: trimming bit applied from OBL (can be read on TRIMR register)

fields.name: TRIM_MR
fields.desc:
TRIM_MR: Main Regulator Output Voltage Trimming
By default, this value is not applied, but taken from the engi bytes; if ENGTRIM.TRIMMREN=1, the startup current can be controlled by this register.

fields.name: SMPSTRIMEN
fields.desc:
SMPSTRIMEN: trimming SMPS enabled
- 1: trimming bit applied from ENGTRIM register
- 0: trimming bit applied from OBL (can be read on TRIMR register)

fields.name: SMPS_TRIM
fields.desc:
SMPS_TRIM: SMPS Output Voltage Trimming
By default, this value is not applied, but taken from the engi bytes; if ENGTRIM.SMPSTRIMEN=1, the SMPS output voltage can be controlled by this register.

fields.name: SMPS_FSM_STATE
fields.desc:
SMPS_FSM_STATE[2:0]: Indicates the current state of the SMPS FSM inside the PWRC.:
- 000: STARTUP
- 001: SMPS_REQ
- 010: SMPS_RUN
- 011: STOP
- 100: NOSMPS
- 101: PRECHARGE
- 110: NOSMPS_BOF

fields.name: FLASH_FSM_STATE
fields.desc:
FLASH_FSM_STATE[2:0]: Indicates the current state of the FLASH FSM inside the PWRC:
- 000: STATE1: FLASH POR
- 001: STATE2: FLASH PWRUP
- 010: STATE3: FLASH READY
- 101: STATE4: FLASH SWITCH OFF
- 110: STATE5: FLASH PWR DOWN

fields.name: PMU_FSM_STATE
fields.desc:
PMU_FSM_STATE[3:0]: Indicates the current state of the PMU FSM inside the PWRC.
- 0000: POR
- 0001: RUN
- 0010: DS ENTRY
- 0011: WAIT1
- 0100: WAIT2
- 0101: WAIT
- 0110: WAIT3
- 0111: WAIT4
- 1000: ISOLATION
- 1001: DEEPSTOP
- 1010: SHUTDOWN
- 1011: DEEPSTOP EXIT

fields.name: RAM_FSM_STATE
fields.desc:
RAM_FSM_STATE[1:0]: Indicates the current state of the RAM FSM inside the PWRC:
- 00: POR
- 01: POWER UP
- 10: READY
- 11: OFF

fields.name: BOFTRIMEN
fields.desc:
BOFTRIMEN: trimming BOF enabled
- 1: trimming bit applied from ENGTRIM2 register
- 0: trimming bit applied from OBL (can be read on TRIMR register)

fields.name: BOF_TRIM
fields.desc:
SMPS_TRIM: SMPS Output Voltage Trimming
By default, this value is not applied, but taken from the engi bytes; if ENGTRIM.BOFTRIMEN=1, the SMPS output voltage can be controlled by this register.

fields.name: LSION
fields.desc:
Internal Low Speed oscillator enable
Set and reset by software.
Reset source only for this field: PORESETn
0: LSI RC oscillator OFF
1: LSI RC oscillator ON

fields.name: LSIRDY
fields.desc:
Internal Low Speed oscillator Ready
Set and reset by hardware to indicate when the Low Speed Internal RC oscillator is stable.
Reset source only for this field: PORESETn
0: LSI RC oscillator not ready
1: LSI RC oscillator ready

fields.name: LSEON
fields.desc:
External Low Speed Clock enable.
Set and reset by software.
Reset source only for this field: PORESETn
0: LSE oscillator OFF
1: LSE oscillator ON
Note that enablng this bit, the configuration of PB12 and PB13 will be bypassed (whatever DFTMUX or AF selection)

fields.name: LSERDY
fields.desc:
External Low Speed Clock ready flag.
Set by hardware to indicate that LSE oscillator is stable.
0: LSE oscillator not ready
1: LSE oscillator ready

fields.name: LSEBYP
fields.desc:
External Low Speed Clock bypass.
Set and reset by software.
Reset source only for this field: PORESETn
0: LSE oscillator bypass OFF
1: LSE oscillator bypass ON
Note that enablng this bit, the configuration of PB13 will be bypassed (whatever DFTMUX or AF selection)

fields.name: LOCKDET_NSTOP
fields.desc:
Lock detector Nstop value
When start_stop signal is high; a counter is incremented every 16 MHz clock cycle. When the counter reaches (NSTOP+1) x 64 value, the lock_det signal is set high indicating that the PLL is locked. As soon as the start_stop signal is low the counter is reset to 0.

fields.name: HSIRDY
fields.desc:
Internal High Speed clock ready flag.
Set by hardware to indicate that internal RC 64MHz oscillator is stable.
This bit is activated only if the RC is enabled by HSION (it is not activated if the RC is enabled by an IP request).
0: internal RC 64 MHz oscillator not ready
1: internal RC 64 MHz oscillator ready

fields.name: HSEPLLBUFON
fields.desc:
External High Speed Clock Buffer for PLL RF  enable.
Set and reset by software.
0: HSE PLL Buffer OFF
1: HSE PLL Buffer ON (default)

fields.name: HSIPLLON
fields.desc:
Internal High Speed Clock PLL enable
0: PLL is OFF
1: PLL is ON

fields.name: HSIPLLRDY
fields.desc:
Internal High Speed Clock PLL ready flag.
0: PLL is unlocked
1: PLL is locked

fields.name: FMRAT
fields.desc:
Force MRSUBG accurate clock ready status (for debug purpose)
0: no effect
1: active_transmission is force to '1' whatever the HSIPLLRDY/HSE status

fields.name: HSEON
fields.desc:
External High Speed Clock enable.
Set and reset by software.
in low power mode, HSE is turned off.
HSE is turned ON only when RFSUBG LDO is Ready
0: HSE oscillator OFF
1: HSE oscillator ON

fields.name: HSERDY
fields.desc:
External High Speed Clock ready flag.
Set by hardware to indicate that HSE oscillator is stable.
0: HSE oscillator not ready
1: HSE oscillator ready

fields.name: LSITRIMEN
fields.desc:
Low Speed oscillator trimming enable
Set and reset by software.
Reset source only for this field: PORESETn
0: LSI oscillator Bias trimming disabled
1: LSI oscillator Bias trimming enabled

fields.name: LSITRIMOK
fields.desc:
LSITRIMOK: Low Speed oscillator trimming OK
Set and reset by hardware to indicate when the Low Speed Internal RC oscillator has reached an optimal trimming of its bias current; this bit is only valid when LSITRIMEN is active.
0: LSI Bias trimming (LSIBW) is not good
1: LSI Bias trimming (LSIBW) value is OK

fields.name: LSIBW
fields.desc:
Trimming in test mode
The value stored is the correspondent Engi Byte and represents the actual value driving the input of the hardware macro.
This value is loaded soon after the completion of the Option Byte Loading procedure.
This field is directly writeable only in Test Mode.

fields.name: HSITRIMOFFSET
fields.desc:
ICSCR[18:16] = HSITRIMOFFSET[2:0]: High Speed oscillator signed trimming offset
 000: 0 (+ 0 MHz / default)
 001: 1 (-0.5 MHz)
 010: 2 (-1MHz)
 011: 3 (-1.5 MHz)
 100: -1 (+2 MHz)
 101: -2 (+1.5MHz)
 110: -3 (+1 MHz)
 111: -4 (+0.5 MHz)

fields.name: HSITRIM
fields.desc:
High Speed Internal clock trimming.
This value is loaded soon after the completion of the Option Byte Loading procedure.
When max value 0x3f is set, HSI is less than 64MHz

fields.name: HSESEL
fields.desc:
Clock source selection request:
0: HSI clock source is requested (default)
1: HSE clock source is requested

fields.name: STOPHSI
fields.desc:
Stop HSI clock source request
0: HSI is enabled (default)
1: disable HSI is requested

fields.name: HSESEL_STATUS
fields.desc:
Clock source selection Status
0: HSI clock source is selected
1: HSE clock source is selected
Mirror the actual system clock source, depending on clock switching mechanism and limitations

fields.name: CLKSYSDIV
fields.desc:
system clock frequency selection request
000: div1 (HSI 64M / HSE 48M)
001: div2 (HSI 32M / HSE 24M)
010: div4/div3 (HSI/HSE)  (16M)
011: div8/div6 (HSI/HSE)  (8M) *
100: div16/div12 (HSI/HSE)  (4M) *
101: div32/div24 (HSI/HSE)  (2M) *
110: div64/div48 (HSI/HSE)  (1M) *
Note: behavior depends on depending on CFGR.HSESEL and (*) APB2ENR.MRSUBGEN or LPAWUREN register

fields.name: CLKSYSDIV_STATUS
fields.desc:
system clock frequency selection status
000: div1 (HSI 64M / HSE 48M)
001: div2 (HSI 32M / HSE 24M)
010: div4/div3 (HSI/HSE)  (16M)
011: div8/div6 (HSI/HSE)  (8M)
100: div16/div12 (HSI/HSE)  (4M)
101: div32/div24 (HSI/HSE)  (2M)
110: div64/div48 (HSI/HSE)  (1M)
Note: behavior depends on depending on CFGR.HSESEL and APB2ENR.MRSUBGEN register

fields.name: SMPSDIV
fields.desc:
SMPS clock prescaling factor to generate 4MHz or 8MHz
0: SMPS clock 8MHz   (default )
1: SMPS clock 4MHz

fields.name: LPUCLKSEL
fields.desc:
LPUCLKSEL: Selection of LPUART clock
0: 16 MHz peripheral clock (default)
1: LSE clock (Mandatory in LPUART deepstop mode)

fields.name: CLKSLOWSEL
fields.desc:
slow clock source selection
Set by software to select the clock source. This is no glitch free mechanism
Reset source only for this field: PORESETn
00: '0' (default)
01: LSE oscillator clock used as slow clock
10: LSI oscillator clock used as slow clock
11:HSI_64M divided by 2048 used as slow clock

fields.name: IOBOOSTEN
fields.desc:
IOBOOSTEN: IO BOOSTER enable
0: IO BOOSTER block is disabled
1: IO BOOSTER block is enabled.

fields.name: LCOEN
fields.desc:
LCOEN: LCO enable on PA10 also in deepstop.
0: LCO output on PA10 is disabled
1: LCO output on PA10 is enabled.

fields.name: SPI3I2SCLKSEL
fields.desc:
SPI3I2SCLKSEL: Selection of I2S clock for SPI3 IP.
00: 32 MHz peripheral clock (default)
01: 16 MHz peripheral clock
10: CLK_SYS
11: CLK_SYS
Note: the I2S clock frequency must be higher or equal to the system clock (configured
through RCC_CFGR.CLKSYSDIV[2:0] bit field).

fields.name: LCOSEL
fields.desc:
Low speed Configurable Clock Output Selection.
Set and reset by software. Glitches propagation possible.
Reset source only for this field: PORESETn
00: LCO output disabled, no clock on LCO
01: not used
10: internal 32 KHz (LSI) oscillator clock selected
11: external 32 KHz (LSE) oscillator clock selected

fields.name: MCOSEL
fields.desc:
Main Configurable Clock Output Selection.
Set and reset by software. Glitches propagation possible.
000: MCO output disabled, no clock on MCO
001: system clock selected
010: na
011: internal RC 64 MHz (HSI) oscillator clock selected
100: external oscillator (HSE) clock selected
101: internal RC 64 MHz (HSI) oscillator divided by 2048 and used as slow clock selected
110: SMPS clock selected
111: AUX ADC ANA clock selected

fields.name: CCOPRE
fields.desc:
Configurable Clock Output Prescaler.
Set and reset by software.
Glitches propagation if CCOPRE is modified after CCO output is enabled.
000: CCO clock is divided by 1
001: CCO clock is divided by 2
010: CCO clock is divided by 4
011: CCO clock is divided by 8
100: CCO clock is divided by 16
101: CCO clock is divided by 32
Others: not used

fields.name: LSISWTRIMEN
fields.desc:
Low Speed oscillator trimming by SW enable
Set and reset by software.
Reset source only for this field: PORESETn
0: LSI oscillator Bias trimming by SW disabled
1: LSI oscillator Bias trimming by  SW enabled

fields.name: LSISWBW
fields.desc:
Low Speed Internal clock trimming value to set by SW
Reset source only for this field: PORESETn

fields.name: LSEDRV
fields.desc:
Maximum Crystal gm for Low Speed External XO
(to connect to XTDRV of 32kHz LSE XO => into IO V33?) to amplify drinving capacity modulation
Set by software.
Reset source only for this field: PORESETn
00: 0.0, low drive capability
01: 0.1,  medium low drive capability
10: 1.0, medium high drive capability
11: 1.1, highdrive capability

fields.name: HSISWTRIMEN
fields.desc:
High Speed oscillator trimming by SW enable
Set and reset by software.
0: HSI oscillator Bias trimming by SW disabled
1: HSI oscillator Bias trimming by SW enabled

fields.name: HSITRIMSW
fields.desc: High Speed Internal clock trimming value to set by SW.

fields.name: KRM_EN
fields.desc:
KRM_EN: Variable rate multiplier Enable
Reset source only for this field: PORESETn
0: KRM is disabled (default)
1: KRM is enabled.

fields.name: KRM
fields.desc:
KRM[4:0] :SMPS clock dividing Ratio (CLK_SPMS_KRM frequency= CLK_ROOT frequency
(depending on RCC_CFGR.HSESEL) divided by KRM when KRMEN=1)
Reset source only for this field: PORESETn
- 0x00 to 0x08: SMPS clock frequency equals CLK_ROOT/8 (8.00 MHz / 6.00 MHz)
- 0x09: SMPS clock frequency equals CLK_ROOT/9 (7.11 MHz / 5.33 MHz)
- 0x0A: SMPS clock frequency equals CLK_ROOT/10 (6.40 MHz / 4.80 MHz)
- 0x0B: SMPS clock frequency equals CLK_ROOT/11 (5.82 MHz / 4.36 MHz)
- 0x0C: SMPS clock frequency equals CLK_ROOT/12 (5.33 MHz / 4.00 MHz)
- 0x0D: SMPS clock frequency equals CLK_ROOT/13 (4.92 MHz / 3.69 MHz)
- 0x0E: SMPS clock frequency equals CLK_ROOT/14 (4.57 MHz / 3.43 MHz)
- 0x0F: SMPS clock frequency equals CLK_ROOT/15 (4.27 MHz / 3.20 MHz)
- 0x10: SMPS clock frequency equals CLK_ROOT/16 (4.00 MHz / 3.00 MHz)
- 0x1x: Reserved
Note: SMPS clock frequency must be selected in a range [4-8] MHz (depending on
RCC_KRMR.KRM and RCC_CFGR.HSESEL).

fields.name: LSIRDYIE
fields.desc:
LSI Ready Interrupt Enable.
Set and reset by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by internal RC 32 kHz oscillator stabilization.
0: LSI ready interrupt disabled
1: LSI ready interrupt enabled

fields.name: LSERDYIE
fields.desc:
LSE Ready Interrupt Enable.
Set and reset by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the external 32 kHz oscillator stabilization.
0: LSE ready interrupt disabled
1: LSE ready interrupt enabled

fields.name: HSIRDYIE
fields.desc:
HSI Ready Interrupt Enable.
Set and reset by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the internal RC 64MHz oscillator stabilization.
0: HSI ready interrupt disabled
1: HSI ready interrupt enabled

fields.name: HSERDYIE
fields.desc:
HSE Ready Interrupt Enable
Set and reset by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the external HSE oscillator stabilization.
0: HSE ready interrupt disabled
1: HSE ready interrupt enabled

fields.name: HSIPLLRDYIE
fields.desc:
HSI PLL Ready Interrupt Enable.
Set and reset by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the HSI 64MHz PLL locked on HSE.
0: HSI PLL ready interrupt disabled
1: HSI PLL ready interrupt enabled

fields.name: HSIPLLUNLOCKDETIE
fields.desc:
HSIPLLUNLOCKDETIE: HSI PLL unlock detection Interrupt Enable.
Set and reset by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the HSI 64MHz PLL unlock.
0: HSI PLL unlock detection interrupt disabled
1: HSI PLL unlock detection interrupt enabled

fields.name: RTCRSTIE
fields.desc:
RTCRSTIE: RTC reset end Interrupt Enable.
Set and reset by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the RTC reset end.
0: HSI PLL unlock detection interrupt disabled
1: HSI PLL unlock detection interrupt enabled

fields.name: WDGRSTIE
fields.desc:
WDGRSTIE: Watchdog reset end Interrupt Enable.
Set and reset by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the watchdog reset end.
0: interrupt disabled
1: interrupt enabled

fields.name: LPURSTIE
fields.desc:
LPURSTIE: LPUART reset end Interrupt Enable.
Set and reset by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the LPUART reset end.
0: interrupt disabled
1: interrupt enabled

fields.name: LCDRSTIE
fields.desc:
LCDRSTIE: LCD reset end Interrupt Enable.
Set and reset by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the LCD reset end.
0: interrupt disabled
1: interrupt enabled

fields.name: LCSCRSTIE
fields.desc:
LCSCRSTIE: LCSC reset release interrupt enable.
0: LCSC reset release interrupt is disabled.
1: LCSC reset release interrupt is enabled.

fields.name: LSIRDYIF
fields.desc:
LSI Ready Interrupt flag
Set by hardware when LSI clock becomes stable.
0: No clock ready interrupt caused by the internal RC 32 KHz oscillator
1: Clock ready interrupt caused by the internal RC 32 kHz oscillator

fields.name: LSERDYIF
fields.desc:
LSE Ready Interrupt Flag.
Set by hardware when LSE clock becomes stable.
0: No clock ready interrupt caused by the LSE oscillator
1: Clock ready interrupt caused by the LSE oscillator

fields.name: HSIRDYIF
fields.desc:
HSI Ready Interrupt Flag.
Set by hardware when HSI becomes stable.
0: No clock ready interrupt caused by the HSI oscillator
1: Clock ready interrupt caused by the HSI oscillator

fields.name: HSERDYIF
fields.desc:
HSE Ready Interrupt Flag.
Set by hardware when HSE becomes stable.
0: No clock ready interrupt caused by the HSE oscillator
1: Clock ready interrupt caused by the HSE oscillator

fields.name: HSIPLLRDYIF
fields.desc:
HSI PLL Ready Interrupt Flag.
Set by hardware when HSI PLL 64MHz becomes stable.
0: No clock ready interrupt caused by the HSI PLL64 MHz oscillator
1: Clock ready interrupt caused by the HSI PLL64 MHz oscillator

fields.name: HSIPLLUNLOCKDETIF
fields.desc: HSIPLLUNLOCKDETIF: HSI PLL unlock detection Interrupt Flag.

fields.name: RTCRSTIF
fields.desc: RTC reset end Interrupt Flag. Raised when reset is released on 32kHz clock

fields.name: WDGRSTIF
fields.desc: WDG reset end Interrupt Flag. Raised when reset is released on 32kHz clock

fields.name: LPURSTIF
fields.desc: LPUART reset end Interrupt Flag. Raised when reset is released on 32kHz clock

fields.name: LCDRSTIF
fields.desc: LCD reset end Interrupt Flag. Raised when reset is released on 32kHz clock

fields.name: LCSCRSTIF
fields.desc: LCSC reset end Interrupt Flag. Raised when reset is released on 32kHz clock

fields.name: REQUEST
fields.desc:
Request for system clock switching
Cleared by hardware when system clock frequency switch is done
0: To cancel an ongiong request - still possible until IRQ assertion
1: To update the system clock frequency

fields.name: CLKSYSDIV_REQ
fields.desc:
system clock frequency selection request
000: div1 (HSI 64M / HSE) (48M)
001: div2 (HSI 32M / HSE (24M*)
010: div4/div3 (HSI/HSE)  (16M)
011: div8/div6 (HSI/HSE)  (8M) *
100: div16/div12 (HSI/HSE)  (4M) *
101: div32/div24 (HSI/HSE)  (2M) *
110: div64/div48 (HSI/HSE)  (1M) *
Note: behavior depends on depending on CFGR.HSESEL and (*) APB2ENR.MRSUBGEN or LPAWUREN

fields.name: STATUS
fields.desc:
Status of clock switch sequence
00: IDLE no switch requested
01: ONGOING clock frequency switch is ongoing
10: DONE clock frequency switch done
11: Reserved

fields.name: EOFSEQ_IE
fields.desc:
End of sequence Interrupt Enable.
Set and reset by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the clock system switch.
0: End of sequence interrupt disabled
1: End of sequence interrupt enabled

fields.name: EOFSEQ_IRQ
fields.desc:
End of Sequence flag
Set by hardware when clock system swtich is ended
0: No end of sequence event occured
1: End of sequece event occured

fields.desc:

Note: when this bit is '1', it must prevent clk_sys different from 16, 32, 64. If the configured clock is lower than 16MHz (1, 2, 4 or 8 MHz) or equal to 24MHz, clk_sys must be 16MHz
0: clock disable
1: clock enable

fields.name: LPAWUREN
fields.desc:
Bubble clock enable
Set and enable by software.
0: clock disable
1: clock enable

fields.name: DBGHSIOFF
fields.desc:
used for debug or test
0: No effect (default)
1: HSI forced off.

fields.name: DBGBYPHSI
fields.desc:
used for debug mode with HSI bypassed by HSE
0: No effect (default)
1: HSI bypassed  HSE.

fields.name: DBGXOEXT
fields.desc:
used for debug mode with HSE bypassed by FXTAL_IN clock and ZIV12 output used.
0: No effect (default)
1: HSE bypassed by FXTAL_IN clock and ZIV12 output used.

fields.name: FORCEXO48MREADY
fields.desc:
FORCEXO48MREADY Force XO48M Ready input signal
This bit is for debug and force the XO48M ready input, in order to bypass XO48M comparators.
0: No effect (default)
1: Force XOREADY=1

fields.name: RMVF
fields.desc:
Remove reset flag
Set by software to clear the value of the reset flags.
It auto clears by HW after clearing reason flags
0: Nothing done
1: Reset the value of the reset flags

fields.name: PADRSTF
fields.desc:
SYSTEM reset flag
Reset by software by writing the RMVF bit.
Set by hardware when a reset from pad occurs.
0: No reset from pad occurred
1: Reset from pad occurred

fields.name: PORRSTF
fields.desc:
POWER reset flag
Reset by software by writing the RMVF bit.
Set by hardware when a power reset occurs from LPMURESET block.
0: No POWER reset occurred
1: POWER reset occurred

fields.name: SFTRSTF
fields.desc:
Software reset flag
Reset by software by writing the RMVF bit.
Set by hardware when a software reset occurs.
0: No software reset occurred
1: Software reset occurred

fields.name: WDGRSTF
fields.desc:
Watchdog reset flag
Reset by software by writing the RMVF bit.
Set by hardware when a watchdog reset from V33 domain occurs.
0: No watchdog reset occurred
1: Watchdog reset occurred

fields.name: LOCKUPRSTF
fields.desc:
LOCK UP reset flag from CM0
Reset by software by writing the RMVF bit.
Set by hardware from unrecoverable exception CPU. It reset V12i domain, FLASH controller and peripherals.
0: No lockup reset occurred
1: lockup reset occurred

fields.name: GMC
fields.desc:
GMC[6:5]: High speed external XO current control reference
00: 10 uA
01: 20 uA
1x: 40 uA
GMC[4:0]: High speed external XO current control multiplying factor
IcoreHSE= GMC[4:0] * GMC[6:5]
Example: GMC[6:0]=0x1111001 -> IcoreHSE=25*40uA / Default 3F:  IcoreHSE= 10uA x 31 = 310uA
Note: this value is set only by software.

fields.name: SWXOTUNEEN
fields.desc:
RF-HSE capacitor bank tuning by SW enable
Set by software

fields.name: SWXOTUNE
fields.desc:
RF-HSE capacitor bank tuning value by SW
Set by software

fields.name: ISTARTUP
fields.desc:
RF-HSE Startup current
Set by software
Default value 2

fields.name: AMPLTHRESH
fields.desc:
RF-HSE Amplitude Control threshold
Set by software
Default value 0

fields.name: XOTUNE
fields.desc:
RF-HSE capacitor bank tuning
Set by option byte loading soon after Power On Reset.

fields.name: AMPLREADY
fields.desc: RF-HSE Amplitude Control Ready output
